p: Groups ( n = 4–6) of 5–6 week old C57BL/6 Stat2 −/− mice were injected i.p. with indicated amounts of pooled serum either from mock-immunised (200 µl/mouse) or ZIKV-80E NP-immunised (at two dose levels: 20 µl/mouse and 200 µl/mouse) BALB/c mice. Two hours following passive transfer, mice were challenged i.d. with 1 × 10 3 plaque forming units (PFUs) of the highly pathogenic ZIKV strain MR766. A group of mice that received neither immune plasma nor the ZIKV challenge was included for comparison. Mice were bled on day 4 to determine viremia by q-RTPCR ( Methods S1). All mice were monitored for 15 days post-infection for survival, development of clinical symptoms and weight loss, as previously described [ 24, 50].
